com.iota.iri.service.snapshot.impl

Class SnapshotImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.iota.iri.service.snapshot.impl.SnapshotImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Snapshot, SnapshotMetaData, SnapshotState

    public class SnapshotImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements Snapshot
    Implements the basic contract of the Snapshot interface.

        public SnapshotImpl(SnapshotState state,
                    SnapshotMetaData metaData)
        /** Creates a snapshot object with the given information. It simply stores the passed in parameters in the internal properties.
        Parameters:
        state - state of the snapshot with the balances of all addresses
        metaData - meta data of the snapshot with the additional information of this snapshot

      • addSkippedMilestone

        public boolean addSkippedMilestone(int skippedMilestoneIndex)
        This methods allows us to keep track when we skip a milestone when applying changes. Since we can only rollback changes if we know which milestones have lead to the current state, we need to keep track of the milestones that were previously skipped.
        Specified by:
        addSkippedMilestone in interface Snapshot
        Parameters:
        skippedMilestoneIndex - index of the milestone that was skipped while applying the ledger state
        Returns:
        true if the index was added and false if it was already part of the set

      • removeSkippedMilestone

        public boolean removeSkippedMilestone(int skippedMilestoneIndex)
        This methods allows us to remove a milestone index from the internal list of skipped milestone indexes. Since we can only rollback changes if we know which milestones have lead to the current state, we need to keep track of the milestones that were previously skipped.
        Specified by:
        removeSkippedMilestone in interface Snapshot
        Parameters:
        skippedMilestoneIndex - index of the milestone that was skipped while applying the ledger state
        Returns:
        true if the skipped milestone was removed from the internal list and false if it was not present

      • update

        public void update(Snapshot snapshot)
        Replaces the values of this instance with the values of another snapshot object. This can for example be used to "reset" the snapshot after a failed modification attempt (while being able to keep the same instance).
        Specified by:
        update in interface Snapshot
        Parameters:
        snapshot - the new snapshot details that shall overwrite the current ones

      • getInitialHash

        public Hash getInitialHash()
        Getter of the hash of the transaction that the snapshot was "derived" from. In case of the "latest" Snapshot this value will be the hash of the "initial" Snapshot. Note: a snapshot can be modified over time, as we apply the balance changes caused by consecutive transactions, so this value differs from the value returned by SnapshotMetaData.getHash(). This is a thread-safe wrapper for the underlying SnapshotMetaData method.
        Specified by:
        getInitialHash in interface SnapshotMetaData
        Returns:
        hash of the transaction that the snapshot was "derived" from

      • setInitialHash

        public void setInitialHash(Hash initialHash)
        Setter of the hash of the transaction that the snapshot was "derived" from. Note: After creating a new local Snapshot we update this value in the latest Snapshot to correctly reflect the new "origin" of the latest Snapshot. This is a thread-safe wrapper for the underlying SnapshotMetaData method.
        Specified by:
        setInitialHash in interface SnapshotMetaData
        Parameters:
        initialHash - hash of the transaction that the snapshot was "derived" from

      • getInitialIndex

        public int getInitialIndex()
        Getter of the index of the milestone that the snapshot was "derived" from. In case of the "latest" Snapshot this value will be the index of the "initial" Snapshot. Note: a snapshot can be modified over time, as we apply the balance changes caused by consecutive transactions, so this value differs from the value returned by SnapshotMetaData.getIndex(). This is a thread-safe wrapper for the underlying SnapshotMetaData method.
        Specified by:
        getInitialIndex in interface SnapshotMetaData
        Returns:
        index of the milestone that the snapshot was "derived" from

      • getSolidEntryPoints

        public java.util.Map<Hash,java.lang.Integer> getSolidEntryPoints()
        Getter for the solid entry points of the snapshot. A solid entry point is a confirmed transaction that had non-orphaned approvers during the time of the snapshot creation and therefore a connection to the most recent part of the tangle. The solid entry points allow us to stop the solidification process without having to go all the way back to the genesis. Note: Nodes that do not use local snapshots will only have one solid entry point (the NULL_HASH). This is a thread-safe wrapper for the underlying SnapshotMetaData method.
        Specified by:
        getSolidEntryPoints in interface SnapshotMetaData
        Returns:
        map with the transaction hashes associated to their milestone index

      • setSolidEntryPoints

        public void setSolidEntryPoints(java.util.Map<Hash,java.lang.Integer> solidEntryPoints)
        Setter for the solid entry points of this snapshot. A solid entry point is a confirmed transaction that had non-orphaned approvers during the time of the snapshot creation and therefore a connection to the most recent part of the tangle. The solid entry points allow us to stop the solidification process without having to go all the way back to the genesis. Note: Nodes that do not use local snapshots should only have one solid entry point (the NULL_HASH). This is a thread-safe wrapper for the underlying SnapshotMetaData method.
        Specified by:
        setSolidEntryPoints in interface SnapshotMetaData
        Parameters:
        solidEntryPoints - map with the transaction hashes associated to their milestone index

      • hasSolidEntryPoint

        public boolean hasSolidEntryPoint(Hash solidEntrypoint)
        This method checks if a given transaction is a solid entry point. It simply performs a member check on the value returned by SnapshotMetaData.getSolidEntryPoints() and therefore is a utility method that makes it easier to check a single transaction. A solid entry point is a confirmed transaction that had non-orphaned approvers during the time of the snapshot creation and therefore a connection to the most recent part of the tangle. The solid entry points allow us to stop the solidification process without having to go all the way back to the genesis. This is a thread-safe wrapper for the underlying SnapshotMetaData method.
        Specified by:
        hasSolidEntryPoint in interface SnapshotMetaData
        Parameters:
        solidEntrypoint - transaction hash that shall be checked
        Returns:
        true if the hash is a solid entry point and false otherwise

      • getSolidEntryPointIndex

        public int getSolidEntryPointIndex(Hash solidEntrypoint)
        Returns the index of the milestone that was responsible for confirming the transaction that is now a solid entry point. A solid entry point is a confirmed transaction that had non-orphaned approvers during the time of the snapshot creation and therefore a connection to the most recent part of the tangle. The solid entry points allow us to stop the solidification process without having to go all the way back to the genesis. This is a thread-safe wrapper for the underlying SnapshotMetaData method.
        Specified by:
        getSolidEntryPointIndex in interface SnapshotMetaData
        Parameters:
        solidEntrypoint - transaction hash of the solid entry point
        Returns:
        index of the milestone that once confirmed the solid entry point or null if the given transaction is no solid entry point

      • getSeenMilestones

        public java.util.Map<Hash,java.lang.Integer> getSeenMilestones()
        Getter for the seen milestones. Note: Since new nodes use local snapshot files as a way to bootstrap their database, we store the hashes of all milestones that have been following the snapshot in its meta data. This allows these nodes to immediately start requesting the missing milestones without having to discover them one by one, which massively increases the sync speed of new nodes. This is a thread-safe wrapper for the underlying SnapshotMetaData method.
        Specified by:
        getSeenMilestones in interface SnapshotMetaData
        Returns:
        map of milestone transaction hashes associated to their milestone index

      • setSeenMilestones

        public void setSeenMilestones(java.util.Map<Hash,java.lang.Integer> seenMilestones)
        Setter for the seen milestones. Note: Since new nodes use local snapshot files as a way to bootstrap their database, we store the hashes of all milestones that have been following the snapshot in its meta data. This allows these nodes to immediately start requesting the missing milestones without having to discover them one by one, which massively increases the sync speed of new nodes. This is a thread-safe wrapper for the underlying SnapshotMetaData method.
        Specified by:
        setSeenMilestones in interface SnapshotMetaData
        Parameters:
        seenMilestones - map of milestone transaction hashes associated to their milestone index

      • update

        public void update(SnapshotMetaData newMetaData)
        Replaces the meta data values of this instance with the values of another meta data object. This can for example be used to "reset" the meta data after a failed modification attempt (while being able to keep the same instance). This is a thread-safe wrapper for the underlying SnapshotMetaData method.
        Specified by:
        update in interface SnapshotMetaData
        Parameters:
        newMetaData - the new meta data that shall overwrite the current one

      • getBalance

        public java.lang.Long getBalance(Hash address)
        Returns the balance of a single address. This is a thread-safe wrapper for the underlying SnapshotState method.
        Specified by:
        getBalance in interface SnapshotState
        Parameters:
        address - address that shall be retrieved
        Returns:
        balance of the address or null if the address is unknown.

      • getBalances

        public java.util.Map<Hash,java.lang.Long> getBalances()
        The Map returned by this method is a copy of the current state which guarantees that the object is only modified through its class methods. This is a thread-safe wrapper for the underlying SnapshotState method.
        Specified by:
        getBalances in interface SnapshotState
        Returns:
        map with the addresses associated to their balance

      • isConsistent

        public boolean isConsistent()
        Checks if the state is consistent, which means that there are no addresses with a negative balance. This is a thread-safe wrapper for the underlying SnapshotState method.
        Specified by:
        isConsistent in interface SnapshotState
        Returns:
        true if the state is consistent and false otherwise

      • hasCorrectSupply

        public boolean hasCorrectSupply()
        Checks if the state of the ledger has the correct supply by adding the balances of all addresses and comparing it against the expected value. It doesn't make sense to call this functions on differential states (returned by SnapshotState.patchedState(SnapshotStateDiff) that are used to check the consistency of patches. This is a thread-safe wrapper for the underlying SnapshotState method.
        Specified by:
        hasCorrectSupply in interface SnapshotState
        Returns:
        true if the supply is correct and false otherwise

      • update

        public void update(SnapshotState newState)
        Replaces the state of this instance with the values of another state. This can for example be used to "reset" the state after a failed modification attempt while being able to keep the same instance. This is a thread-safe wrapper for the underlying SnapshotState method.
        Specified by:
        update in interface SnapshotState
        Parameters:
        newState - the new state that shall overwrite the current one

      • applyStateDiff

        public void applyStateDiff(SnapshotStateDiff diff)
                    throws SnapshotException
        This method applies the given SnapshotStateDiff to the current balances. Before applying the SnapshotStateDiff we check if it is consistent. This is a thread-safe wrapper for the underlying SnapshotState method.
        Specified by:
        applyStateDiff in interface SnapshotState
        Parameters:
        diff - the balance changes that should be applied to this state.
        Throws:
        SnapshotException - if the SnapshotStateDiff is inconsistent (see SnapshotStateDiff.isConsistent())

      • patchedState

        public SnapshotState patchedState(SnapshotStateDiff snapshotStateDiff)
        This method creates a differential SnapshotState that contains the resulting balances of only the addresses that are modified by the given SnapshotStateDiff. It can be used to check if the modifications by a SnapshotStateDiff will result in a consistent State where all modified addresses are still positive. Even though this State can be consistent, it will most probably not return true if we call SnapshotState.hasCorrectSupply() since the unmodified addresses are missing. This is a thread-safe wrapper for the underlying SnapshotState method.
        Specified by:
        patchedState in interface SnapshotState
        Parameters:
        snapshotStateDiff - the balance patches that we want to apply
        Returns:
        a differential SnapshotState that contains the resulting balances of all modified addresses
